Generation V.Black: When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, they can make waves in water or earthquake-like vibrations on land.
Generation V.White: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to capture prey.
Generation V.Black 2: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to immobilize its opponents.
Generation V.White 2: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to immobilize its opponents.

Generation VI.X: When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, they can make waves in water or earthquake-like vibrations on land.
Generation VI.Y: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to immobilize its opponents.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, they can make waves in water or earthquake-like vibrations on land.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to immobilize its opponents.

Generation VIII.Sword: It weakens its prey with sound waves intense enough to cause headaches, then entangles them with its sticky tongue.
Generation VIII.Shield: On occasion, their cries are sublimely pleasing to the ear. Palpitoad with larger lumps on their bodies can sing with a wider range of sounds.
